title: "I watched a clickbait Youtube video and now I think Maokai is garbage"

replies.body:
I don't care about the Clickbait video. 

I care about scenarios where I'll never be able to use W on a Fiora, I care about being unable to use  my W for a catch on a Tristana because she'll W away and take me with her to her team.
''but that can already happen''
yes but this gives people way more reaction time to do that, making it way more reliable.
It is almost like counterplay should be a thing or something

Sion is my second highest mastery. 
I am all for counterplay done right. This however is stupid.
Huh. Didn't expect Sion to be your no. 2 main.

There are some similarities :P
Both are pretty damn telegraphed, both have this ''high Counterplay High Reward'' desing theory, both make me feel like I can always get better at them, and both are objectivly  manly as fuck. :^)

Trains and Barrels apparently, the man's a regular DK.


Note: I don't know Tidal, I'll never know Tidal, I just wanted to share my joke.

> [{quoted}](name=crippler38,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=cEJdvAYr,comment-id=000a0000000000000000,timestamp=2017-04-20T21:59:09.249+0000)

> 
> Note: I don't know Tidal, I'll never know Tidal,

Not with that attitude you won't.
not while living in NA as a bronze 4 either.
You can know me in that case.
I saw it used in-game in one of Foxdrop's recent uploads, and it IS really slow. I thought so even before the Quinn video.

It's supposed to be slow. It's supposed to give people more time to react. In return he got a ton of CC with his new ult and some other damage redistribution. Changing his W allows more power to be added to the rest of his kit.

His ult is just as slow though. W was very important to Maokai because he had to be fairly close for his whole kit to be effective. Now they have this weird...like long range engage/flank I guess? Follow-up engage? I'm not really sure what his new play pattern was intended to be.
You can recall before his ult get to you.

hahahahah so true lol... I could just imagine someone being troll seeing him ult and just recall and not even be halfway to get him yet... hell he could probably get back to lane as well and then dodge it... unless maokai is on top of you that ult is completely useless
I saw it in Anklespankin's video. Someone in the comments said it was bugged. Let's hope it's true.
Its Rioter confirmed. It's supposed to accelerate, snd they're working on a solution
Whats a Tioter?
Basically everything about Twisted Advance got nerfed except for its mana cost at ranks 1-3, though.

And he gained power in the rest of his kit. Maokai as he is now is good for flash-rooting a carry and generic tank stats from his Ult. Thats all he is. They needed to take power away from his W so they could add to the rest of his kit

You are really god damn stupid if you think the rest of his kit gained power.   His new ult may be the most worthless ult in the game.  It is just a slower Nami ult that doesn't even stun/knock up, it just roots.

with gaps in between and each root only grabs one person... if his w gets sped up to the old speed I can see the ult being extremely useful as its hard to dodge when its right next to you but if they can see you comin everything is ruined...
The current version of twisted advanced on the pbe is bugged.
they changed it speed back to live values today.
As opposed to now? All he does is W-Q a carry then walk around with his tank stats until his W comes off CD again. At least now he can CC 2-3 people with his ult in fights.
and then the {{champion:77}} runs you back to the middle of his team and beats the shit out of you
it's also a bug. Not intended feature.
Couldn't catch an ulting {{champion:497}} who charmed the entire team. There's some merit to calling the W change bad.
It's also a bug, so no, there no merit.
What's the bug? That it's slow? If so that's nice.
They were trying a version where it accelerates over the duration, so it starts slow and builds up speed. That didn't work though, so they've reverted it back to the Live speed.
Oh that's nice. I wouldn't mind it accelerating, just the initial slow speed feels bad.
That was the bug if I understood correctly, it was supposed to start slow and accelerate but it wasn't accelerating.
Ok cool. Guess I'll reevaluate my stance once I can try it again without the bug.
"most auto attacks don't reach a 800 ms character" what are you challenged?

I think people forget that all reworked abilities are tentative and subject to change.

His old w was a tad on the strong side but we'll see what riot decides
Except Riot has a track record of leaving in some very questionable abilities.

> [{quoted}](name=Melledoneus,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=cEJdvAYr,comment-id=00090000,timestamp=2017-04-20T21:18:01.144+0000)
>
> Except Riot has a track record of leaving in some very questionable abilities.

I still rue Darius' ignite passive and base armour shred...
He had that even before the rework. His passive did even more damage back then.
Remember when Riot Olafed Olaf and he wasn't played for 2-3 years?
They've even said that the W speed was a bug. It was intended to start slow and speed up, but the acceleration didn't work. They've already reverted it back to the Live speed on the PBE.
No, maokai isn't just garbage because of his w being slower. He lost damage reduction on his ult, a long ass cd on his passive, and lower damage on q and w for some unreliable damage on E.

yeah but theres thresh lantern, flash, ghost, bard portals, vi, basically any dash or teleport breaks 750ms. 

if you use it when they use their mobility ability then you will never interrupt it, only land after they do and be alone.... and dead...

The clickbait video isn't even clickbait though. It brings to life the point of Quinn's ult being too fast for Maokai's W. Sure in the video {{item:3742}} was fully stacked and everything but with all of these slight buffs, maokai got 1/3rd the distance of the quinn with all the buffs. **Quinn should still be able to outrun maokai with only her ult**.  

I looked through the comments in the thread you mentioned and hardly saw any upvoted comments saying that Maokai is garbage. The point of the video isn't even about all of Maokai's kit. **It's only about the speed of his W**. Where you got this "maokai is garbage" thing is beyond me.

There was a bug with Mao W..

It's why they release things on PBE first.

It was supposed to start slow and become faster... 

It's rioter confirmed now.

I know it's a bug. But we don't know what the max speed will end up being. Quinn could very well still outrun Maokai's W, even at full speed. 

We can't guarentee this won't happen with the final release.

NOTE

That was a bug...

Post was released a bit ago..

Speed is supposed to increase over time.. That was the base..

The speed not increasing was a bug so riot is gonna fix that.

So I know that since this was originally posted Riot explained that this was a bug for Maokai, but either way I'm gonna throw in my two cents here; I mained Maokai jungle back before his first rework and VU, back when he cast his ult in an AoE on the ground and his W had a cast time and you could play him as a legit mage in addition to a tank. That W cast time meant that 90% of champs with any form of mobility (all if you count flash) could reposition maokai's end location at will, and while it had trade offs for both sides (usually wasted escape tools from the target, and unpredictable end location for Mao) it was a much healthier ability, even though it had significantly longer range and higher travel time. I'd rather they give it back the range and cast time, returning it's strategic strength ***AND*** its counterplay.

Especially now that they finally gave him the passive fix I've been pushing for for years (boost the heal but make it only work on Mao's abilities) and tuned his saplings to be extra strong jungle vision, if they were to buff the cast range in exchange for the cast speed, Maokai could finally return to the jungle where he belongs.
He will be a jungler, his ultimate is just too good for ganking and his clears are insane.

His ult looked way too slow from what I've seen, it mostly looks like a zoning tool. They'll probably tweak that around though, and we know they're gonna fix his W so that won't be an issue.

That said, the sapling and passive buffs are hella strong indeed for the jungle, especially early clearing. I'm so excited to get my main back :D
